channel.title: CVE Feed for HCL Software -- HCL Launch
channel.description: The latest CVEs for HCL Software -- HCL Launch

item.title: CVE-2022-27548|2024-08-03T05:33:00.116Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20launch
item.description: HCL Launch stores user credentials in plain clear text which can be read by a local user.

item.title: CVE-2022-27549|2024-08-03T05:32:59.249Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20launch
item.description: HCL Launch may store certain data for recurring activities in a plain text format.

item.title: CVE-2021-27784|2024-08-03T21:33:15.655Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20launch
item.description: The provided HCL Launch Container images contain non-unique HTTPS certificates and a database encryption key. The fix provides directions and tools to replace the non-unique keys and certificates. This does not affect the standard installer packages.

item.title: CVE-2022-27551|2024-08-03T05:32:59.846Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20launch
item.description: HCL Launch could allow an authenticated user to obtain sensitive information in some instances due to improper security checking.

item.title: CVE-2022-42445|2024-08-03T13:10:40.998Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20launch
item.description: HCL Launch could allow a user with administrative privileges, including "Manage Security" permissions, the ability to recover a credential previously saved for performing authenticated LDAP searches.

item.title: CVE-2022-42452|2024-08-03T13:10:40.896Z -- hcl%20software -- hcl%20launch
item.description: HCL Launch is vulnerable to HTML injection. Â HTML code is stored and included without being sanitized. This can lead to further attacks such as XSS and Open Redirections.
